entry.et: Middle English, from Middle French or Latin; Middle French, from Latin ambition-, ambitio, literally, act of soliciting for votes, from ambire

def.dt: :an ardent desire for rank, fame, or power
:the object of ambition her ambition is to start her own business
:a desire for activity or exertion felt sick and had no ambition

entry.pt: ambition aspiration pretension mean strong desire for advancement. ambition applies to the desire for personal advancement or preferment and may suggest equally a praiseworthy or an inordinate desire driven by ambition. aspiration implies a striving after something higher than oneself an aspiration to become president someday. pretension suggests ardent desire for recognition of accomplishment often without actual possession of the necessary ability and therefore may imply presumption has literary pretensions.
